data.title: Jagoda Kamov
data.text:
Art'Morte challenges perceptions and expands minds through a blend of physical and traditional theatre, exploring mortality as an intimate, personal experience. Under the visionary leadership of Artistic Director Jagooda Kamov, our performances delve into profound themes such as nihilism, dark psychology, dehumanization, absurdism, silence, stillness, void, and empty spaces. Jagooda's innovative approach employs a combination of movement, physical expression, and dramatic storytelling, enriched by environmental sounds to craft unique, thought-provoking theatrical experiences.

Art'Morte Collective is a dedicated group of passionate artists and thinkers committed to exploring the darker, often taboo aspects of the human condition across various artistic mediums. We believe that by confronting these difficult subjects head-on, we can foster greater understanding, empathy, and healing. Our diverse body of work encompasses literature, theater, visual arts, and more, all with the aim of illuminating the complexities of the human experience.

Currently, we are excited to be working on a movement-based stage adaptation of 'No Longer Human' by Osamu Dazai. Our talented creative team for this production includes Jagooda Kamov, Mika Shirahama, Peijia Hu, Takatsuna Mukai, Gillian McIver, Hanya Elghamry, and Reiko Nagayoshi. Together, we strive to bring this poignant narrative to life, seamlessly integrating physical theatre with dramatic elements to invite audiences into its deep emotional and psychological landscapes.

In addition to our performances, Art'Morte offers charity-based workshops focusing on body trauma release and the profound topic of mortality. These workshops are designed for creatives seeking to develop their work and for individuals dealing with pre-grief and the realities of death. By addressing these deeply personal and universal themes, we provide transformative experiences that foster deep insights and healing.

Art'Morte believes in the power of art to offer solace and understanding. By combining powerful performances with meaningful community engagement, we create art that not only entertains but also supports emotional and psychological well-being. Our work helps people confront and process their feelings about mortality, offering comfort and a sense of connection in the face of lifeâ€™s greatest certainty.
